page.title: 03GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY 2
page.content: Railway continued... In the Second World War it had one anti-aircraft siding with two guns. There were four different kinds of engines: they were 0-6-0t pannier tanks,0-4-0 prairy tank,electric and a 0-6-0 saddle tank. West bay used to be called Bridport Harbour but the railway men called it West Bay so gradually it was changed to Westbay.The railway ran at the bottom of Boarsbarrow Hill and there was an accident at Bradpole crossing when a diesel locomotive failed to stop at the gates. Luckily there was no casualties. There were also two other branch lines of the G.W.R. They were the line from Abbotsbury to Weymouth that was also a single track and the big line from Bristol to Weymouth that was a double track.
